name: camestros
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wex(s0, w0)
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wex(s0, w0)
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))

body.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, w2))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wex(s0, w0)
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, w2))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w2)))

comment: "Camestros", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic. All ` ph ` is ` ps ` , no ` ch ` is ` ps ` , and ` ch ` exist, therefore some ` ch ` is not ` ph ` . In Aristotelian notation, AEO-2: PaM and SeM therefore SoP. For example, "All horses have hooves", "No humans have hooves", and humans exist, therefore "Some humans are not horses". (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.) Reduce dependencies on axioms. (Revised by BJ, 16-Sep-2022.)
